Logic

Class EnvironmentInformation

  • java.lang.Object
    • Logic.EnvironmentInformation

  • public class EnvironmentInformation
extends java.lang.Object
    The class EnvironmentInformation provides the client with all the informations available about the environment the game it's being played.

    This class stores all the useful information the client may need about the environment the game it's taking place. The field that is used as environment is represented by a grid world. This information stored includes three categories: field's information, players' information and ball's information. - The field's information category consists of the number of rows and columns the grid world has and the position of the goals. - The players' information category consists of the maximum number of players per team and the players' position on the grid world. - The ball's category consists of the position of the ball in the grid world and the information of who has the ball.

    Version:
    v0.1 04/10/2014
    Author:
    Eduard de Torres
    See Also:
    Position

    • Method Detail

      • parseInfo

        public void parseInfo(java.lang.String serverInfo)
        Converts the server information String into accessible information stored in the EnvironmentInformation instance.

        Parses the information provided through the server information string and updates the information stored in the EnvironmentInformation instance.

        Parameters:
        serverInfo - server information String.

      • isBallMine

        public boolean isBallMine()
        Return whether the ball is in possession of the client's player or not.
        Returns:
        true if the client's player have the ball in possession, false otherwise.

      • isBallMyTeam

        public boolean isBallMyTeam()
        Return whether the ball is in possession of the client's player's team or not.
        Returns:
        true if any of the client's player's teammates has the ball in possession, false otherwise.

      • isBallOtherTeam

        public boolean isBallOtherTeam()
        Return whether the ball is in possession of the client's player's rival team or not.
        Returns:
        true if any of the players in the rival team has the ball in possession, false otherwise.

      • getPlayerHasBall

        public boolean getPlayerHasBall(int num)
        Returns whether any of the players with the number num in any of both teams has the ball.
        Parameters:
        num - the number of the player the ball possession will be checked on.
        Returns:
        true if any of both team players with number num has the ball.

      • getHave_ball

        public java.lang.String getHave_ball()
        Returns a coded string with the information of the team and player number that has the ball.

        Returns a string with the format "Team/Number". The Team field can be either M for the client's player's team of O for the client's player's rival team. The Number field can go from 1 to MAX_PLAYERS.

        Returns:
        a coded string with the information of the team and player number that has the ball.

      • setHave_ball

        public void setHave_ball(java.lang.String have_ball)
        Sets the information of the team and player number that has the ball with a coded string.

        Sets the information of the team and player number that has the ball with a coded string using the format "Team/Number". The Team field can be either M for the client's player's team of O for the client's player's rival team. The Number field can go from 1 to MAX_PLAYERS.

        Parameters:
        have_ball - a coded string with the information of the team and player number that has the ball
